title: Are all news and information on the internet true? Why or why not? - Quora

response.answer_text: No. Why? It would be too rigorous, expensive and time consuming for all posts to go through a fact-checking process before being displayed. It would also require an infallible fact-checking process, which would be more of a goal than a reality. Why not? Pretty much the same reason as “why,” plus it would remove the incentive to utilize the medium. And if someone smarter than I were to devise a perfect methodology, it could always be hacked.

A big NO!. There are some sights aimed at spreading propanda, Then there are those that publish unverified information and so on. its only 20% that is truely genuine. These others 80% are falsifyed,altered or propaganda. Be cautious
